iv SIGHT READING IN LATIN

The book contains rather more matter than is included in Books HI and IV of the Gallie War. The first thirty exercises are taken from Eutropius, Aulus Gellius, Pliny, Cicero, and Livy. In some cases needed modifications have been made in the Latin, especially in the Livy.

The other exercises are taken from Nepos's lives of Hannibal and Hamilcar, from Caesar's Civil W ar, and from Books ΠΙ to VII, inclusive, of the Gallie War. In every case the attempt has been made to have the Latin tell a complete episode or story in a series of exercises. Where chapters have been omitted, a re'sume of the contents is given in English.
